about.credits:
![Soristic](https://soristic.sgp1.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com/assets/mainlogo-very-small.png)
This simulation activity development was supported by multiple stakeholders, including [a group of students](https://github.com/inmyshoesdev/inmyshoes/people) from the National University of Singapore. These characters were developed through rounds of interviews with people from various backgrounds and situations, allowing us to craft out a simulation that portrays similar events faced. Subsequently, Soristic has been improving the simulation by introducing more new characters as well as conducting workshops.

info.text: You are from a low-income family. You live in a rental one-room flat.
In addition to your parents, you live with your two grandparents (who are also cleaners), and two younger siblings.
You work a part-time job at a fast food restaurant and have a little bit of savings. You find it hard to make friends because you are embarrassed about your situation.

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You find yourself having a personal conversation with a friend and both realise that you can count on each other.
Your health and social points increase by 3

narrations.name: msg
texts:
After doing some research online, you are able to find a support organisation for low-income students.
Your wealth points increase by 3

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You are now suffering from anxiety due to stress. You are constantly worried even if there is no direct cause and sometimes find it hard to breathe.
Health points decrease by 2

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You increasingly feel distant from your friends and family.
Social points decrease by 2

narrations.name: msg
texts:
One of your parents has lost their job. Until now, your parents has been living from paycheck to paycheck so there are no savings available. Therefore, you will have to contribute some of your allowance to help them cover the household expenses.
Wealth decreases by 2

options.name: health message
options.text:
You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

*You have earned a Health Badge!*

badges.name: health badge
badges.text: You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

options.name: social message
options.text:
You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

*You have earned a Social Badge!*

badges.name: social badge
badges.text: You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

options.name: wealth message
options.text:
Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

*You have earned a Wealth Badge!*

badges.name: wealth badge
badges.text: Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

options.name: helping hand message
options.text:
You have made attempts to be more open to approaching other for help. Remember, you are not alone in your journey!

*You have earned a Helping Hand Badge!*

badges.name: helping hand badge
badges.text: You have made attempts to be more open to approaching other for help. Remember, you are not alone in your journey!

narrations.name: intro
texts: In this exercise, you will have the chance to choose a character and discover what youth might go through in various aspects of their life.

Each character has a health, social and wealth meter. As these are meant to reflect the physical, social and financial conditions of the characters, their starting values will differ depending on the character being played.

narrations.name: intro2
texts: Just like real people, the characters will fare better if their financial, physical and social needs are taken care of. So try and keep them up if you can.
Content warnings: mental health, learning disabilities, income issues.

options.text: Go

narrations.name: household
texts: You are Curtis. You are from a low-income family. You live in a rental one-room flat.

narrations.name: family
texts: In addition to your parents, you live with your two grandparents (who are also cleaners), and two younger siblings.

narrations.name: work
texts: You work a part-time job at a fast food restaurant and have a little bit of savings. You find it hard to make friends because you are embarrassed about your situation.

options.text: Go

narrations.name: woke
texts: Your parents and siblings are grateful for your help. But, you start to feel the effects of sleep deprivation as you find it difficult to focus in school and at work.

narrations.name: slept
texts: You manage to get the much needed rest, and you are ready to take the day on. However, your siblings are late for school and the are upset at you for not waking them up.

speeches.text: It's 5:30 already..? I'm still so tired from working last night.
Mom and Dad came home late from work last night and are still fast asleep. The siblings need to get ready for school What do I do?

options.text: Get up and get your siblings ready for school
Sleep in and hope that your parents will get up in time

narrations.name: purchase
texts: By spending a little bit of money, you received the nutrition you need to start the day strong. At the same time, you caught up with some of your friends before the school day started.

narrations.name: leftovers
texts: Your parents greatly appreciate the breakfast you had prepared for them. But, eating the leftovers was not sufficient for you, making you feel hungry and tired for the rest of the day.

speeches.text: Time for breakfast! There isn't much food at home though, only some leftovers which isn't enough for me and my parents.
Or, I could head to school and get a subsidised meal! Hmm...

options.altText: Head to school and purchase a subsidised meal
Save some money! Share the leftovers for breakfast with your parents

narrations.name: day
texts: **Later...**

narrations.name: walked
texts: You managed to save some money by walking to school, but you missed out on spending some time with your friends and could not catch up with them.

narrations.name: transport
texts: You spent some money to top-up your transport card and managed to reach school early. You had the chance to spend some time with your friends before classes, bonding more.

speeches.text: Ok I guess it's time to head to school!
Gosh school is so far, should I take public transport or go for a 40min walk today?

options.altText: Save money and walk
Take the public transport and arrive at school early

narrations.name: intro
texts: At school

By mustering up the courage to ask for an extension, you were able to take some stress off. At the same time, your teacher became more aware of your situation and paid more attention to your needs as a student. Subsequently, you were able to go to work for the day and made some extra cash for the family.
Staying up all night to complete your work was a lot of stress for you, and you did not get enough sleep for the next day. You were also unable to report to work and lost out on the day's earnings.

speeches.text: Curtis, your assignment was poorly done. Please redo it and hand it in to me tomorrow.
Okay, thank you Mrs Lee.
I can't believe I have to redo my assignment...
Oh no, I have work later plus I need to take care of my siblings. I'll have to stay up tonight if I want to finish this!
Ummm, excuse me Mrs Lee, is it okay if I request for an extension for this assignment?
I need to report for work later, and I still need to help out at home later today. I don't think I have the time to complete the assignment.
Oh! I was not totally aware of your situation. I apologise. Sure, you don't need to submit it tomorrow, how about by the end of next week?
Yes, that would work! Thank you so much!

options.text: Approach your teacher and ask for an extension
Stay up late to finish your assignment

narrations.name: intro
texts: Some of your classmates invited you to go watch a movie with them after school. You are concerned about the money that you need to spend.

narrations.name: rejected
texts: After turning down your friend once more, you start to feel like the friendship is fading and you fear that they might no longer ask you out in the future. You head straight home, without having to spend any extra cash.

narrations.name: agreed
texts: The movie was enjoyable and you had a lot of fun with your friends. It was a memorable day and you feel yourself getting closer to your friends. However, you spent a good amount of your money for the movie and other snacks and you will probably need to work extra hours to make up for it.

speeches.text: Hey, Curtis! It's been awhile since we hung out as a group. How about we go catch a movie today?
I'm really tight on cash now but I've  been turning Dennis down for the past few times...
I really do want to spend more time with him, but I can't be spending money like that...
Sorry! I have to head home today. Maybe some other time?
Again? Oh alright, next time then! Take care, Curtis!
Okay! Let's go catch that movie!
Nice! We're gonna have so much fun, Curtis!

options.altText: Save money and head straight home
Join your friends for a movie

narrations.name: intro
texts: Upon reaching home, you notice that your grandmother is feeling unwell and requires medical attention.

Your grandmother is grateful for your help. But, as a result, you had to fork up some cash to pay for the medical fees, despite subsidisation through the CHAS card. At the same time, you start to feel a little more stressed as you had to rush back to prepare dinner and do your school work.
You gain some time for the rest of the day after preparing dinner, and you have some time for your school work and for yourself. You get enough sleep and rest for the next day.

speeches.text: Ah Curtis... You're home. I am not feeling well right now, could you take me to the doctor?
Should I bring my grandmother to see a doctor today? However, my parents mentioned that they will be working late today, and I need to prepare dinner for the rest of the family...
Thank you so much Curtis! The doctor has given me proper medication and I feel much better now!

options.altText: Take your grandmother to go see a doctor
Attend to your grandmother another day, and prepare dinner for the family

narrations.name: day
texts: **Next day...**

narrations.name: intro
texts: Your friends have decided to get matching house t-shirts in school and want you to purchase one.
You feel more included within your group of friends, but you had to fork out some of money from your savings. You also feel a little stressed from spending the money unnecessarily.
You didn't need to spend money from your savings, but you feel really embarrassed and guilty for making your friends pay for you once again.

speeches.text: Hey Curtis! We're going to be designing and printing new house shirts. It's going to be so cool when we all wear it together! Are you in?
Oh sounds like a great idea, but I'm really tight on cash right now.
At the same time I don't want to feel left out of my own clique...
Okay sure! I'm excited!
Sorry! I need to save up my money for my family.
Oh that's alright, we can always pool some cash together for you!

options.text: Fork out some money from your savings
Tell them about your situation

narrations.name: intro
texts: Because of your existing responsibilities, you have been busy and are having trouble understanding some of this week’s lessons.
You end up heading to the library, which took some cash to travel to. At the same time, you still found it hard to understand the week's syllabus and you feel increasingly stressed.

You feel a great sense of relief as your friend agreed to help you even though he is busy himself. Your friend was also happy that he could help even just a little, and it became a chance for you and your friend to bond.

speeches.text: This topic is tricky, should I ask someone for help?
But exams are coming, Im sure everyone is busy. Maybe I should just head to the library.

options.altText: Head to the library
Call your friend to ask for help

narrations.name: day
texts: **Saturday**

narrations.name: intro
texts: You have made it to the weekend, but your laptop breaks down so that you can’t finish your remaining tasks.

Through some research, you realise that there are organisations that give out free laptops to low income households giving you a great amount of relief. You also learn that there is a community of young people who are facing similar challenges.
Going to the library costs you a bit of money for the transport, and studying alone in the library dampens your mood.

speeches.text: Ugh... What luck! I still have my school assignments to complete. My laptop must've been too old...
What now?

options.altText: Reach out to a charity
Back to the library

narrations.name: intro
texts: Bills have increased this month and your parents are already working overtime to make ends meet. You need to find some dinner for yourself, your grandparents and your siblings.
Going to work helps you earn extra cash, but the leftovers you got were nutritionally insufficient for you and your family.
By going to the hawker centre, you bought enough food for the family, and received the nutrition that you need.

speeches.text: Almost time for dinner... What should I do?

options.altText: Go to work
Order some takeout

narrations.name: day
texts: **Monday**

narrations.name: intro
texts: Your teacher notices that your grades are slipping and tries to offer you help by signing you up for free remedial classes after school hours.

Taking some time off work to go to the classes gives you some room to breathe, and you have a little more time to rest. However, your parents seem a little upset as you are no longer earning money to help support the family.
By skipping the classes, you commit more to your work, earning more money for the family for which your parents are grateful for.

Having to juggle between remedial classes, work, and taking care of your family can be increasingly stressful for you. At the same time, you lose out on a lot of sleep and rest. However, you manage to earn some cash for the family and your parents are very grateful for the help.

speeches.text: My grades haven't been improving for quite some time..
The remedial classes could help, but I don't have a lot of time, and it might clash with my work. What should I do?

options.text: Attend all the classes
Skip the classes
Attend the classes when you can

narrations.name: intro
texts: You’re finding it difficult to cope with school, work and having to help out at home. You consider quitting either school or work to manage better.

Focusing all your time in school helped you to improve your grades, and you start to feel more confident in your own abilities. You have more time for your family and for yourself, and you get to spend more time with your friends as well. However, as you quit your work, you find yourself spending more money than the amount you are saving.

By focusing all your time for working, you help bring some more money back home and you realise that you are eating better and saving more. However, you do not see your friends anymore and you start to lose contact with them.

speeches.text: Juggling between family, work and school has become increasingly difficult for me... I've been losing a lot of sleep, and I feel much more stressed. I can't keep up!
I should weigh my options here...

options.altText: Quit work and focus on schooling
Stop schooling and go full-time

narrations.name: intro
texts:
You have reached the end of this exercise. 

We rarely have the full picture of what our fellow students, friends or family members may be going through. Our actions can have significant positive or negative consequences, so it is up to us to show respect and care.

By stepping into Curtis’ shoes, you may have realised that: 

Many young people have caring responsibilities at home which they have to juggle alongside their academic and social life. 

Most social activities cost money, which may hinder low-income individuals from participating unless there is a more inclusive alternative.
Socioeconomic status is a sensitive topic that many may not want to discuss. Are there ways to be accommodating without being intrusive?

options.name: yes
options.text: Restart?

options.name: another
options.text: Change Character?

info.text: You are from a middle-income family. In addition to your parents, you also live with your two younger siblings.
You are dyslexic. You are in the process of being assessed for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), but your official diagnosis has not come through yet.
You are relatively popular with a large circle of friends. However, you are not well-liked by some teachers at school because they do not understand your learning needs.
You have an allowance that is just enough for your expenses.

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You find yourself having a personal conversation with a friend and both realise that you can count on each other.
Your health and social points increase by 3

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You find out that someone else in your class has been experiencing the same learning difficulties as you, and that dyslexia can affect as much as 10% of students.
Your health and social points increase by 3.

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You are now suffering from anxiety because of your academic stresses. You are constantly worried even if there is no direct cause and sometimes find it hard to breathe.
Health decreases by 2.

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You increasingly feel distant from your friends and family.
Social points decrease by 2

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You are suddenly engrossed in your current task that you totally forgot about your other responsibilities.
Social points decrease by 2.

options.name: health message
options.text:
You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

*You have earned a Health Badge!*

badges.name: health badge
badges.text: You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

options.name: social message
options.text:
You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

*You have earned a Social Badge!*

badges.name: social badge
badges.text: You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

options.name: wealth message
options.text:
Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

*You have earned a Wealth Badge!*

badges.name: wealth badge
badges.text: Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

options.name: helping hand message
options.text:
You have made attempts to be more open to approaching other for help. Remember, you are not alone in your journey!

*You have earned a Helping Hand Badge!*

badges.name: helping hand badge
badges.text: You have made attempts to be more open to approaching other for help. Remember, you are not alone in your journey!

narrations.name: intro
texts: In this exercise, you will have the chance to choose a character and discover what youth might go through in various aspects of their life.

options.text: Go

narrations.name: household
texts: You are from a middle-income family.
In addition to your parents, you also live with your two younger siblings.

narrations.name: health
texts: You are dyslexic.
You are in the process of being assessed for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), but your official diagnosis has not come through yet.

narrations.name: relationships
texts: You are relatively popular with a large circle of friends.
However, you are not well-liked by some teachers at school because they do not understand your learning needs.

narrations.name: finance
texts: You have an allowance that is just enough for your expenses.

options.text: Go

texts: You are less well-rested and sense that you will struggle more in the classroom today.
Your teacher appreciates the fact that you did as much of the work that you could and tried to hand it on time.
You would have woken up at 7:00am anyway.
You know that your teacher will be disappointed at you for turning in your homework late.

speeches.text: I'm so tired from staying up till 3am to do my assignment that is due today... And I still haven't finished it!
(*checks time*)... oh no its already 6am? Should I get up and try to finish it again?
Ok I guess I will try to finish it again. I dont want to disappoint my teachers again!
It's no use, I won't be able to finish it anyway, might as well get some rest!

options.altText: Wake up at 6:00am to complete your homework
Sleep till 7:00am to get enough rest for school

narrations.name: intro
texts: You are preparing breakfast for your siblings.
You get anxious about going home later. You also end up having to grab home since you dont know your way.
You arrive late for school which upsets your teacher.

speeches.text: Hey! Stop running around and get ready for school!
(*Looks around for her phone*) Oh no where did I put my phone? I left it here just a minute ago...
Ugh... I'm running late! Should I just head to school? But I need the GPS as I might get lost on the way back home...
There's no time and I'm running late, I'll just try to manage without it later.
I definitely have to look for it, I have no choice..Ms Ong is going to be so mad..

options.altText: Forget the phone and make your way to school
Try to look for your phone

narrations.name: intro
texts: Your class is starting.
Even though you have more time, your work is starting to snowball.
However, your teacher has a better understanding of your circumstances which improves your relationship.
You will be sleep-deprived and stressed the following day.
You will not be able to spend time with your friends after school.
With the help of your friend you managed to finish the task much faster. Though you had to put in extra time to get it done.
You develop a closer relationship with your friend.

speeches.text: Belinda, can you redo this assignment? There are too many spelling errors. It is difficult for me to understand your writing.
Oh ok...
I am very sure I checked all my answers and didn't see any errors! Ughh! How am I going to tackle this?
Hey Belinda! What's wrong? Do you need any help?
Ms Ong, can I please get an extension for this assignment. I have other assignments due and I am feeling swarmed at the moment.
Hmm..Okay I'll give you 2 additional days to get things done.
Thank you so much!
Yeah..I have this assignment I need to redo on top of all other things we already have assigned..
Oh no, let me help you with the assignment that you need to redo. I think I got most of the questions right for that paper.

options.text: Ask your teacher for an extension on the grounds of learning difficulties
Try to finish it on your own
Ask for help from a friend

texts: You see some people try to contain their giggles as you make many reading mistakes.
Your feel less confident about yourself though your teacher tries to help you along.
You feel a little disappointed in yourself.
You feel less confident.

speeches.text: Who can help me read the next passage?
How about you Belinda, can you try and read this passage?
Oh no, my dyslexia is really bad today, I can barely make out what the first sentence is!
I don't think I'll be able to read it out loud in class... It will be really embarrassing if I mess it up. What should I do?
Okay Ms Ong ...*(gulp)*...
Uh..*(speaks gibberish)*
Hahahahah..
Uhm Ms Ong? Can I skip this page? I am not very confident right now..
Hmm alright, but you're going to have to practice if you want to get better.

options.text: Attempt the reading
Ask to be excused

narrations.name: intro
texts: During break, you bump into your classmates at the canteen.
Their comments were hurtful and you can’t stop thinking about them.
Your friends think that everything’s fine and don’t check in with you about the incident.
You feel relieved because you are able to have an open discussion.
Your friends now understand that the comment was offensive and hurtful, and promise to stand up for you if it happens again.

speeches.text: Hey Belinda what was that gibberish you were spewing earlier? it was hilarious! Wasn't it guys?
Yeah hahah
Uhm..*(awkward laughter)*
*(From a distance)* Hey! Thats not funny. Try putting yourself in her shoes! Let's go Belinda!
Sigh...That was really hurtful. Being a student sure is tough...
Thanks for sticking up for me..seeing those guys laugh at my dyslexia makes me feel terrible.
Just ignore them! It's great that you tried anyway. That's what counts!
Thanks, Emily.

options.text: Laugh it off and pretend you didn’t hear them
Talk to your friends about why those remarks were hurtful

narrations.name: intro
texts: You try your best to focus in class, but just can't seem to digest anything.

narrations.name: later
texts: *Later*
You understand the material better and your confidence increases.
The tuition is expensive and you have to bear some of the cost through having your allowance reduced.
You manage to catch up but not as much as you would've liked since your condition is still getting in the way. You feel stressed.
Emily appreciates it that you asked them for help and you are closer than ever.

speeches.text: This new topic is so confusing, I can barely understand the content!
*(looks over to her friend)* Wow. Emily seems to be having no problems at all...She is going through the questions so fast...
I really should put in more effort for my studies. I remember seeing a notice about a new tuition centre for students with learning difficulties...What should I do?
Wow the teachers seem to be doing a good job.
That's it, I'm going to ask my parents to sign me up for this.
Thanks for helping me out, Emily.
Its okay, do you get it now?
Yeah...sort of I guess haha
I'm still finding this difficult due to my dyslexia

options.altText: Go to check out the new tuition center

options.text: Ask a friend for help because tuition is expensive.

narrations.name: intro
texts: You get home and you have work to do but you notice something on your television.
Your work is left undone.
You are stressed.
You are able to relax after having completed your work, although you feel quite tired.

speeches.text: Finally, I'm home. I can get started on the homework that has been piling up.
Oh what's that? The new edition of my favourite game is out?
I've been waiting for ages! Maybe I can squeeze in time for one game.. Just one game...
Wow the game is really intense...
Oh no it's already so late?? I completely lost track of time...
I haven't even started on what I need to do!
Hmm I'm finally done with work.
I guess it was a good thing I decided not to play the game. After all, I can always play it another time.

options.altText: Purchase the game and play it for a bit before doing homework
Focus on your homework

narrations.name: intro
texts: You arrive in class and your teacher hands back your test results.
You keep having to lie to your parents about how you are doing in school which stresses you out further.
You feel embarrassed in front of your friends which makes it difficult to have a normal conversation with them.
Your parents understand that you have some difficulty with learning.

speeches.text: Here is your paper Belinda. I'm disappointed that you scored so low since this was an easy test. You need to focus more!
Thank you Ms Ong...
Ahhh! I'm so embarrassed!! Ms Ong even said that in front of the whole class... And how am I going to tell my parents about my results?
Hiding things from my parents is always so tiring...
But I can't share this with them. They will be so unhappy.
Mum..Dad..here are my results..
Hmm I know you're disappointed but it's okay. We know you're having a tough time coping. Just keep working hard and trying your best!

options.text: Hide the issue for as long as you can
Tell your parents

narrations.name: intro
texts: Later, your teacher prepared a special activity for your class.
Your idea actually helps the class to uncover the solution. Everybody is pleasantly surprised at your ability and you get a boost of confidence.
Friends appreciate your ability more and give you more recognition.
Eventually the class discovers the clue that you noticed on their own and solve the puzzle.
You’re happy that you were right but you regret staying silent.

speeches.text: Okay class for today's activity I will split you into groups. You are expected to work together to solve this puzzle.
Wow this is really difficult, we've been on this for quite awhile but still can't figure it out!
Wait a minute, I think I have this figured out.
Should I say something? I'm not sure if they will be willing to listen to me...
Hey guys I think you've missed something here...
Wow Belinda, you're right. We didn't look at things that way. The solution is so much more obvious now...
(*After a long time*)...Wait a minute what if we change this and this..I think we are starting to see something here.
Looks like I was right all along. Maybe I should have said something instead of just keeping quiet...

options.altText: Step forward with your idea
Stay quiet

narrations.name: intro
texts:
You have reached the end of this exercise.

We rarely have the full picture of what persons with disabilities may be going through. Our actions can have significant positive or negative consequences, so it is up to us to show respect and care.

By stepping into Belinda's shoes, you may have realised that:

Learning difficulties do not reflect a person's intelligence. Your mental image of someone with a learning disability may not be accurate.

These issues affect close to 10% of students across ages and genders.

Learning difficulties affect life outside of the classroom.

They can be linked to feelings of social isolation, low self-esteem and poor mental health.

It is possible to accommodate learning difficulties. Just because someone is struggling in a mainstream setting does not mean they cannot 'cope'.

To find out more, visit: 
[Dyslexia Association of Singapore YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/c/DyslexiaAssociationofSingapore/featured)
 [Martel, P. (2021).Comics about the daily struggle with ADHD](http://adhd-alien.com/)
 [Yeo, S. (2020).The invisible struggle of girls with ADHD](https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/parenting-education/the-invisible-struggle-of-girls-with-adhd)

options.name: yes
options.text: Restart?

options.name: another
options.text: Change Character?

info.text: You are from a well-to-do family. In addition to your parents, you also live with your retired grandmother and a dog.
You have quite a bit of allowance compared to your peers each month.
You are suffering from depression. You used to have a large circle of friends but have lost touch with some of them.

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You find yourself unable to enjoy the activities you once liked.
Your health and social points decrease by 2

narrations.name: msg
texts:
The weather outside is great today and instantly improves your mood.
Your health points increase by 3

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You find yourself having a personal conversation with a friend and both realise that you can count on each other.
Your health and social points increase by 3

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You have been unable to fall asleep recently.
You are constantly tired and your health points decrease by 2

narrations.name: msg
texts:
You increasingly feel distant from your friends and family.
Your social points decrease by 2

options.name: health message
options.text:
You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

*You have earned a Health Badge!*

badges.name: health badge
badges.text: You have been trying to take better care of your physical and mental health the past week and it shows! You feel more energized and rejuvenated compared to before.

options.name: social message
options.text:
You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

*You have earned a Social Badge!*

badges.name: social badge
badges.text: You have put in the effort this week to spend more time and connect with your friends and family. You feel your relationships with them have strengthened.

options.name: wealth message
options.text:
Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

*You have earned a Wealth Badge!*

badges.name: wealth badge
badges.text: Your efforts at saving and earning money in the past week have been effective. While income issues don't disappear overnight, you feel you can go into the next week with a slightly better sense of financial security.

narrations.name: intro
texts: In this exercise, you will have the chance to choose a character and discover what youth might go through in various aspects of their life.

options.text: Go

narrations.name: background
texts: You are from a well-to-do family.
In addition to your parents, you also live with your retired grandmother and a dog.

narrations.name: health
texts: You are suffering from depression.

narrations.name: relationships
texts: You used to have a large circle of friends but have lost touch with some of them.

narrations.name: finance
texts: You have quite a bit of allowance compared to your peers each month.

options.text: Go

narrations.name: intro
texts: It’s 7:00am, which is when you need to wake up to go to school.
Recently, you have been experiencing insomnia and have only slept for two hours every night.

narrations.name: wake
texts: You are quite tired as you woke up on time, and you feel that your mood will be low for the rest of the day.

narrations.name: sleep
texts: By waking up a little later, you get some extra rest, and you feel a little more energised for the day.

speeches.text: I'm so tired, should I sleep a little more?

options.altText: Try to wake up on time
Get some extra rest

narrations.name: intro
texts: It’s time for breakfast.
Your parents have made a full spread for the entire family but your depression has resulted in a loss of appetite.
However, you feel guilty, which worsens your mental health and lack of appetite even further.

narrations.name: skip
texts: By skipping breakfast, you did not get enough nutrition for the rest of the day. You feel tired and hungry.

narrations.name: eat
texts: While eating breakfast, you had the time to sit down and talk to your parents, who usually leave for work early. At the same time, you feel energised after consuming breakfast.

speeches.text: Arthur! Come grab your breakfast before school!
I don't feel like eating at all... But my Mom spent so much effort to make breakfast for me.
Should I just try and eat something?

options.text: Skip breakfast
Eat breakfast

narrations.name: intro
texts: After getting some extra rest, you realise that you are now running late for school.

narrations.name: bus
texts: Having to run when switching between different bus numbers while trying to reach to school on time was stressful.
You eventually made it to school, but had to walk to your desk in the middle of class.
You were embarrassed for having to disrupt the class by coming in late.

narrations.name: taxi
texts: By taking a cab, you manage to reach to school early, giving you some time to catch up with your friends.
The cab however did cost quite a bit as it was peak hour.

speeches.text: Shoot! I'm running late. Should I book a cab or take public transport?
I'll definitely be late if I take public transport, though I'll be saving a lot of money since cabs have peak hour fares now.

options.altText: Take public transport
Take a taxi

narrations.name: intro
texts: At school, your teacher tells you to redo one of your assignments by tomorrow.
The feedback causes you significant stress along with your other work.
You feel anxious and moody and bite your fingernails to destress.

narrations.name: stay
texts: You stayed up late to complete the assignment, which did not help with the stress you are experiencing. The lack of sleep also negatively affected your mood.
But, having submitted your work, your teacher was proud of you for putting in the effort.

narrations.name: extension
texts: By speaking to your teacher, your teacher understands the difficulties you are facing.
You also feel much more relieved, as you have enough time to properly redo the assignment.

speeches.text: Arthur, your assignement was poorly done. Please redo it and hand it in tomorrow.
Ugh... It seems like I just can't do anything right.
I'm probably going to screw it up again. What do I do?
Sorry Mr Chua, I don't think I can complete it by tomrrow.
I would like to produce better work but I don't think I can with my current state of mind.
Okay, I understand it can be stressful at times. I'll give you till the end of this week.

options.text: Ask for an extension
Stay up late to finish the assignment

narrations.name: intro
texts: Your friends are going bowling after school and ask if you want to come.
You don't really have the energy to join them but you acknowledge that it might be fun.

narrations.name: bowl
texts: You end up spending some money for bowling and snacks, but you had a wonderful time with your friends and you feel much more included in your group of friends.

narrations.name: home
texts: By going straight home, you saved some money.
However, spending time alone dampened your mood, as you feel lonely and you worry about how your friends might think of you after turning them down.

speeches.text: Hey Arthur! Are you heading home now? Do you want to go bowling with us?
Should I join them? I know it will be fun but I don't really have the energy right now.
Maybe I should go home and spend some time alone...

options.text: Join your friends for bowling
Head home

narrations.name: intro
texts: One of your friends has posted a photo of you on Instagram from when you went bowling, and you are feeling very insecure about the way you look.

narrations.name: delete
texts: You feel relieved that the photo is no longer online.
You are very anxious about whether your friend will agree to take the photo down or think differently of you.
You also communicated in a slightly aggressive manner due to your irritability.

narrations.name: nothing
texts: You can’t stop thinking about the photo and wish you could hide away from the world.
You feel insecure, distressed and upset at yourself.

speeches.text: (receives notification) Oh Ethan posted a photo of us?
(looks at phone) Oh no this is such a terrible photo of me, all my insecurities are so clear to everyone to see!
Should I ask Ethan to remove this photo or change it?
Hey Ethan can you take down that photo you posted? I'm the only one that looks horrible in it!
What? I think you look fine but If it makes you feel better I guess I could.
Man that picture is getting more likes by the day.
Now I'm even more anxious about how I appear infront of others...

options.text: Ask them to take it down
Say nothing but continue to feel insecure

narrations.name: intro
texts: One of your friends posts a photo of their bowling trip, which makes you feel alienated.
You feel that your friends don’t like you any more and might have talked about you behind your back.

narrations.name: food
texts: You find it hard to cope, so you end up binging on fast food. You have to pay for the food.
You feel better momentarily but it doesnt solve the underlying problem. You end up feeling worse overall.

narrations.name: text
texts: Knowing that this situation is normal and it happens to everyone ever so often, you feel great relief.
You are also happy that you could speak to your friend about it and you feel like you have bonded with Ethan more.

speeches.text: (looks at phone) Wow they seem to be having so much fun without me.
They must have talked about how anti-social and boring I am for not going...
Should I do something to cheer myself up?
Wow that meal was pretty good
I feel stuffed now though. I wonder if the rest ate here too before they went to bowl...
Hey Ethan, I'm sorry for not joining you guys, I wasn't up to it.
But you guys look like you had fun and now I wish was there!
No worries! There are days where I don't have the energy or mood to go out too. I think it's perfectly fine!
And, we can always go out again in the future!

options.text: Try cheering yourself up by buying yourself dinner
Text Ethan about feeling left out

narrations.name: intro
texts: You’ve been finding it tough to keep up with school work but you have a big test coming up.
You are trying to force yourself to study harder but you keep telling yourself that there is no point and it is too late.

narrations.name: parents
texts: Your parent’s stress how important the test is and that you need to do well to make sure you graduate with good grades.
This places you under additional stress, and you don't feel supported by your parents.

narrations.name: friends
texts: Your friends offer to study with you when they can.
Though you still have a lot to cover, this helps you cope slightly better.

speeches.text: (looks at calendar) Oh no, the test is right around the corner!
This is bad, the test is important but I'm so behind on my work.
But I don't even think it makes a difference anymore... what should I do?
Mom, I'm so nervous for the upcoming test.
I haven't been able to study properly for it recently.
You should have prepared for this sooner.
You know that it is important and will determine where you go after this.
Hey Ethan, I've been feeling so stressed about the upcoming test.
I havent even been able to study properly for it.
It's okay. Tell you what, we can study together after school whenever you're free.
I can try to help you with what I can.

options.text: Talk to your parents about it
Tell your friends how you are feeling

narrations.name: intro
texts: Recently, your parents have been arguing more frequently which is causing you to lose sleep.
When you arrive at school, the teacher notices that you are visibly more fatigued than usual.

narrations.name: silent
texts: You feel that such issues are much too sensitive to share and you keep your emotions bottled up.
At the same time, your relationship with your teacher suffers as he thinks that you just spend your night scrolling through your phone.

narrations.name: talk
texts: Your teacher assures you that it is okay to share things with him and you start to feel comfortable sharing your problems.
This helps relieve a lot of your emotional burden.

speeches.text: Arthur, you barely participated in class today and I caught you dozing off a few times.
Is everything okay?
Oh no, I hardly got any rest yesterday and the day before.
He senses that something is wrong but I am not sure if I should tell him...
What should I do?
Everything is just fine Mr Chua, I'm just a little tired.
Okay. You should try and sleep earlier Arthur.
Stop using your phone all night!
Well, I havent been able to sleep well because of what's happening at home.
Oh, are you alright? You can always come to my office and we can talk about it.
My ears are always open, Arthur.

options.text: Keep things to yourself as this is a very personal problem
Open up to him

narrations.name: intro
texts: Your friend who you haven’t spent time with in a while notices the dip in your mood this week and offers to treat you to your favourite ice cream.
However, your parents have asked you to go home early the entire week to help look after your grandmother as both of them are busy with work.

narrations.name: icecream
texts: Going to get some ice cream did not take too much of your time, and you were able to reach home to take care of your grandmother.
Though you had to spend some money for travelling, you spent some quality time with your friend, which lightened your mood.

narrations.name: grandmother
texts: You skip on giving yourself a mental break.
You also make yourself feel like a bad friend, seemingly pushing your friend away again.

speeches.text: Finally school is over, gotta rush home to take care of grandma...
Hey Arthur, wait for me!
Oh what's up Ethan!
Is everything okay?
What do you mean?
Seems like you've been feeling down lately.
Oh I'm fine... really...
Hey, how about I treat you to some ice cream?
What should I do?
You know, that doesnt sound like a bad idea. Okay, let's go!
I'm really sorry Ethan but I need to get home ASAP to look after my grandmother.
Well okay... take care. I'll see you around then.

options.text: Go home a little later and grab some ice cream
Tell your friend you won’t be able spend time with him yet again

narrations.name: intro
texts:
You have reached the end of this exercise. 

We rarely have the full picture of what our fellow students, friends or family members may be going through. Our actions can have significant positive or negative consequences, so it is up to us to show respect and care.

By stepping into Arthur's shoes, you may have realised that: 

**Managing your mental health is a continuous, day-to-day process.** It is part of everyday life and not just what is visible or diagnosed.

**Depression looks different on everyone** - some people experience trouble sleeping and a loss of appetite, and others have related issues such as binge eating and social anxiety.

**It can be hard for people with depression to reach out to others** because of guilt, or social stigma. Just because somebody appears more resilient does not mean that they are doing okay.

options.name: yes
options.text: Restart?

options.name: another
options.text: Change Character?
